website_summaries.verdict: An accurate, high-quality sound level meter, though the price tag may put it out of the reach of some.
pros: Lightweight and fits in the palm of your hand
Can be mounted on a tripod for hands-free operation
cons: This sound level meter is on the expensive end
It only detects sounds as low as 40 decibels

customer_reviews.title: Decent Product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because of a noisy neighbor above my apartment. Local police department uses it so I bought to be able to obtain same readings they would get if (when) I have to make a noise complaint. It would be nice if it had a wifi ability so it could obtain its own date/time stamp to create a noise record. Right now, I have to hold my smartphone beside it to show date/time when I start measuring. Not a big deal, but a nice to have. I have to make the video anyway, so I live.
customer_reviews.author: Tahir J. Naim

customer_reviews.title: Terrible sound pressure meter
customer_reviews.text: Terribly designed. Battery holder is absurd, LCD is impossible to read in most lighting situations, power button was broken. Bottom is curved so you can't stand the meter up. If you lay it down the microphone touches the surface you are putting it on which causes the reading to be inaccurate. Complete piece of garbage. Terrible mechanical and usability engineering.
customer_reviews.author: Fluff

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 20 minutes then did not response to any sound anymore.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for 5-6 times more than those low end products expecting to get a high quality one. But no, just the opposite. It worked out of box for about 20 minutes then the reading went on its own and did not response to any sound anymore. Also it seems cheaply manufactured - metal part looks dull and plastic parts are roughly fit. I am packing it for a return. Will try a different brand other than Extech.
customer_reviews.author: B. Li

customer_reviews.title: Excellent device. High Quality Scientific Instrument.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Sound Meter. This meter measures sounds of 40-130 decibels. Works very well. It comes with a foam ball which is added on the top of the mic for better sound absorption. It has to methods of measuring decibels A weighting and C Weighting. C is for sounds generated by machinery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, instructions clearly written, good quality device, sturdy, well made
customer_reviews.author: New England

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Does what i need it to do and performs as the manufacturer claims. Quality seems as decent as any other similar gadget.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: A very good and not too expensive sound level measuring device. It has a professional rating and is therefore viable for submission to government agencies overseeing community sound violations. I recommend buying it if needed.
customer_reviews.author: mrneige

customer_reviews.title: Worked out great. The CEO of our company needed confirmation of ...
customer_reviews.text: Did what we needed to do with this. Worked out great. The CEO of our company needed confirmation of what would be the best alternative for soy prodding his office. This helped us determine the best scenario. All went well.
customer_reviews.author: sdsulesky

customer_reviews.title: not good quality
customer_reviews.text: it has a low frequency capture. if the sound you are trying to measure last for less than a second It will not capture it. I can't read a 40 ms sound. it is a problem
customer_reviews.author: valex

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A / V installer now makes my home theater installs sound amazing
customer_reviews.author: corey

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, and very accurate
customer_reviews.text: I use this device to measure sound pressure generated by my PA sound systems. This device can also be used to verify that you are staying within legal limits regarding noise abatement laws. If you do a lot of sound work, you should get one. They are very easy to use, and can 'remember' maximum readings if necessary. Definitely Five Stars!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Sisemore

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Can't use it without a calibrator also. Question is why offer it for sale without telling buyers it is useless unless calibrated every time but no calibrator included or advised.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Kid

customer_reviews.title: Checking Sound Levels
customer_reviews.text: Got this to 'see' the level of the sound intensity around me from various home products as I have diminished hearing from military duty and Vietnam. Sort of like getting 'bundled' software you didn't request on a computer. There are buttons and features that just make the operation a bit more difficult but one doesn't have to use them.
customer_reviews.author: VN PH CIB TET

customer_reviews.title: Great decibel meter...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good decibel meter. As a mobile disc jockey, this comes in quite handy to make sure that music is playing at an appropriate sound level for the audience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a good device, just the case it's a problem
customer_reviews.text: It's a good device, just the case it's a problem. We need more protection. If you want protect your equipment it's necessary to buy it in other shop and make one special for the device.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Caiza

customer_reviews.title: Informative
customer_reviews.text: Used it to see how loud a concert was. What I learned made me glad I was wearing earplugs! Peach music festival could reach 100 decibels easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Calibration?
customer_reviews.text: Extech Sound Level Meter 407730: $70. Extech External Calibrator 407744: $300 - $500. I kid you not. According to the instruction manual on page 4, "To calibrate the meter, an external calibrator such as the Extech 407744 04 the Extech 407766 is required in addition to a small screw driver." And later, "Calibrate the instrument before each use if possible. Especially if the meter has not been used for a long period of time. So, to summarize: * Many good features * Easy to use * Not that expensive * Calibrated? Maybe not.
customer_reviews.author: TerraByte

customer_reviews.title: Great for people who complain about loud volume
customer_reviews.text: As a camp director I was faced with people complaining that the band was too loud. I used this meter to prove to them that the band was within a safe volume range. They stopped complaining that it was too loud. If the band had been too loud (according to the meter), I would have asked them to turn their volume down.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Help save your hearing
customer_reviews.text: I lost some of my hearing in the military, and my father did before me. Hearing loss is progressive, painless, and permanent. I got this device so I could compare the sound levels in my gym to what is reported to be safe, so I can protect what is left of my hearing. This device did fine for this. I learned that 85 decibels is the loudest sounds you should be exposed to, and that this is louder than what I find pleasant even with my favorite songs jamming. But I'd recommend more people get this. What is your hearing worth? Lose it and you'll find out. This device is cheap by comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Maurice McIver

customer_reviews.title: accurate and cheap.  cant beat it.
customer_reviews.text: title says it all. used it with the police outside my junkyard when neighbors call in a noise complaint. awesome to whip it out and be like, oh sorry, im under the legal limit so why dont you f*** off very much please. great for loud exhausts too.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua T.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: For a design project, I needed to measure some sound levels to make sure a device is UL compliant. This meter was set up next to a $5K reference meter and the readings were within a few dB most of the time. Pretty impressive for an inexpensive meter.
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: Great little SPL Meter
customer_reviews.text: The device works great. Two things that it does not have are a backlight for dark environments (concerts, shows, etc.), and it also has a very pesky auto-off function so the battery does not drain. If this device did not have these, it would be perfect in my opinion. Still works great though!
customer_reviews.author: Ken F.

customer_reviews.title: meter okay, but missing back light
customer_reviews.text: Noise meter works fine and easy, but the lack of back lighting makes it useless in darkness. So, if you are trying to catch loud night time parties by your neighbors, this meter here won't be that usefull to you.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: I purchased both the Extech 407732 and the Reed St-805 ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased both the Extech 407732 and the Reed St-805. The Prime price currently has the Reed cheaper by $30. Except for the color of the case they are the same instrument. Same button layout, same functions. Everything the same but the color in the plastic case. I also purchased the sound calibrator from Reed. It was significantly cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Finn

customer_reviews.title: Sound problem
customer_reviews.text: We had some air conditioners that people were complaining that it was hurting their ears with him running yet you could have a conversation in right next to them so this digital sound level meter settled the problem is a good investment
customer_reviews.author: Country Club Estates

customer_reviews.title: Works for my needs
customer_reviews.text: So I jam in a 6 piece band and our practices are always way too loud. I got this to show everyone that we're seriously damaging our hearing. After getting this bad-boy, I scientifically proved that we were way too loud. Now when we sound check we can tone it down a bit to where we can play without ruining the future of our hearing.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Phan

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I am the safety manager in a plant; I bought this to get an idea if our noise levels warranted a hearing conservation program. It is only good for an initial screening; for a more definitive answer, you need a personal noise dosimeter. However, for a very reasonable price it gives you some initial screening data. It seems like a pretty good unit, especially for the money.
customer_reviews.author: WayneB

customer_reviews.title: No, it isn't and no, it isn't
customer_reviews.text: One of my 2 favorite simple tools. This and a stopwatch can really shutdown some complaints before they get very far. 1. It's noisier than any of the other ones, and 2. It's taking longer than before... ah, science to the rescue.
customer_reviews.author: Dave-by-the-Beach

customer_reviews.title: Bought this to have a cheapie Type 2 meter around ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to have a cheapie Type 2 meter around, but the thing has a calibration problem when on "slow" setting. Fast seems to be OK.
customer_reviews.author: fiatowner

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: The on/off button doesn't work. That should be enough but, half the functions don't either. Maybe I got a lemon but it's a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Rowden

customer_reviews.title: Lotas features, reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: The right feature set for measuring machine noise levels at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: joe nemchik

customer_reviews.title: it work's
customer_reviews.text: Forced to update, seem's touchy. Have had to adj calibration every time I used it. the 407730 held calibration but could not get an ansi rateing to it. This was an updated requirement for state motorcycle inspection.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Falardeau

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Extechs decibel digital sound meter is simple to use. The digital read out is large enough to see easily, fits comfortably in one hand and the keys are easy to reach with my thumb. Leaving my other hand free.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie C

customer_reviews.title: It would have been nice if a fitted case was included
customer_reviews.text: For the price this meter works as expected. It would have been nice if a fitted case was included, even if only genuine plastic, this meter does take care of basic noise metering .
customer_reviews.author: Theodore K Hogan

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Nice meter with great features for the price range. Typical Extech quality and function.
customer_reviews.author: Dual-500

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little dB meter that was used in my daughter's science project. She did well. The ranges are broad enough to cover most applications. The meter reproduced the levels accurately. Good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: BlackCoffee

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I returned this after finding the same unit under a different brand for less money.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Frady

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: I bought the meter to check the noise of Pickleball and traffic in the community where I live. It works fine and I was able to measure all the sound in and around the courts.
customer_reviews.author: bighitter

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: It works exactly as expected, but it is a bit bulkier than is probably necessary. It would be nice if there were a directional feature that could be toggled, so you could get a noise level from a particular source or direction.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan R. Shepard

customer_reviews.title: easy to use.  a calibration device may be needed
customer_reviews.text: easy to use. not sure if not having a calibration device is going to serious impact accuracy
customer_reviews.author: RAP

customer_reviews.title: Great, inexpensive, versatile SPL Meter
customer_reviews.text: After buying a cheap SL meter, I was looking for a better model that offered the ability to do Slow response and able to be calibrated. This one fit the bill and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Cari (Des Moines)

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I use this to set consistent level for stereo system testing. I have found it to be very consistent between tests. I cannot speak to the absolute value of the decibel levels but this is perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: garym

customer_reviews.title: Extech sound meter
customer_reviews.text: I recently entered a contest sponsored by Lockheed Martin called Silent Stamina where the objective was to design and build a model airplane that would fly the longest time and not produce more than 60 db at full throttle. This was the cheapest sound level meter I found with an accuracy of +/- 2%. My meter read about 1.5db to 2db below the contest directors meter, close enough.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Burk

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This a nice sound level for the price. I have been happy with it so far. I have used it on and off for the past few months. It is easy to use and read. It is a nice basic sound meter!
customer_reviews.author: KelMay

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: The Extech 407730 is a good value for the person or company who needs an inexpensive way to read noise levels in any given environment. We operate lumber handling/processing machinery in a large semi-open area and needed a way to read noise levels in order to set boundaries for hearing protection zones and this product has provided us the information we needed.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works very well and showed results that I didn't think that the situation would remain the same.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Barbu

customer_reviews.title: Very Good for Price
customer_reviews.text: Verry good instrument for the price. Not apprpraiate instrument for longterm sound studies. Would reccomend for simple sound testing. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Big E in Hickory

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Auto mode not much use unless just measuring constant background noise. Manual modes OK.
customer_reviews.author: Cort Klein

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: The delivery was very quick. It is very easy to use and works perfectly. I bought it so we had evidence against a problem neighbor; the town is now prosecuting!
customer_reviews.author: K9Doc

customer_reviews.title: but for checking on noise complaints it is a good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Works well for the price-point. Does not have the features of higher cost meters, but for checking on noise complaints it is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tested well when put on my calibrator. I have ...
customer_reviews.text: Tested well when put on my calibrator. I have used it mainly for industrial use and the accuracy and certification are sufficient for my porposes. Has maintained the calibration over the last few weeks without noticeable significant errors.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Manery

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I am well pleased of the quality of this product and the difference it makes in our worship center.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: nice unit, good value
customer_reviews.text: I use this db meter in a professional recording studio for spot-checking SPL around the control room throughout the day and work week. It's tremendously easy to use and anyone can quickly find their way around it's buttons.
customer_reviews.author: SoundDude

customer_reviews.title: It met our needs
customer_reviews.text: We recommend the Digital Sound Level Meter. It worked great for us. It measured the noise level we wanted to test.
customer_reviews.author: 7 Zion

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Meter
customer_reviews.text: I need the meter for reference purposes. The meter is of good quality and works well. I have no way of knowing if it is perfectly accurate, but I don't need it to be perfect. I have it on a tripod for testing motorcycle exhaust noise. It works very well for what I use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Pontefract

customer_reviews.title: It Did it's Job
customer_reviews.text: It works well in a crowd of 100 for the sound system. It is serving its purpose just fine. Fast Shipping. Thank You
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: The best sound level meter ever!
customer_reviews.text: As a life long audiophile who grew up with the popular Radio Shack sound level meter, I found the Extech 407732 to be a most impressive step up in both form and function. This well designed and user friendly device makes channel level balancing even more accurate and is most helpful when measuring surround speakers. Sound level measurements are displayed in digital form and the meter is easily managed with one hand making sound level adjustments that much easier. This is a great tool that I wish I had discovered years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Hal Owen

customer_reviews.title: Worked good what more can I say
customer_reviews.text: I needed a high quality sound meter so as to verify or challenge sound findings in a project report. I was almost sure the data in the report was erroneous, however since I knew that my ears would not be considered as accurate sound instruments, I bought this meter. I found it very easy to use, and it more than verified that the information in the report was vastly inaccurate. Numerous other people have also used it and I have not heard any complaints about it. For me it was a very good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Joe A.

customer_reviews.title: shiped fast
customer_reviews.text: This product works as expected. If you have a loud talker in your office this works great to let them know.
customer_reviews.author: Adam M. gis

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Kept our company, dB down (db-down.com) out of the dog house at the NAMM show.
customer_reviews.author: William4

customer_reviews.title: Sound Meter
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, works well. Was shipped promtly. Unit can be calibrated by Mfr if you need an official reading.
customer_reviews.author: Rosy

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says. Feels solid in your hand. Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says. Feels solid in your hand. Works very well. Good range of sensitivity. Easy to use. Good features.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon

customer_reviews.title: Decent product
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a quality product. Works for the purpose I wanted it for. Would recommend it to others looking for next step up from the $25 versions.
customer_reviews.author: GA Joe

customer_reviews.title: performs as promised
customer_reviews.text: Needed an economical, easy-to-use sound meter for my purposes. This one fits the bill very well. Simple, but sensitive - love the ability to measure over time and it remembers the high and low values
customer_reviews.author: James E. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Everything's fine
customer_reviews.text: This product works well and they shipped it to me on time. I have no problems with it. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent unit. Well made
customer_reviews.text: Excellent unit. Well made, easy to use. Only minor dislike is auto off. I buy the batteries, I decide when it goes off.
customer_reviews.author: John J. Welsh

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: The first one arrived missing a table in the battery compartment and didn't work. I exchanged it with no effort and the new unit works as expected. Handy lil guy and smaller than I expected (9"'s long). I wish it had a case or pouch but I'll toss it in an old mic pouch and in the gig bag. It has an auto off feature which should keep me from running the batteries out by mistake. Very happy with it for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive sound meter
customer_reviews.text: Considring the price this instrument measured up nicely against others costing nearly 10 times the amount. Was certainly adequate for what are using it for.
customer_reviews.author: donnie51

customer_reviews.title: a bit too sensitive
customer_reviews.text: The meter is easy to use and has a clear display, but it is so sensitive that even when a sound seems pretty consistent to a human ear, the readings go up and down dramatically.
customer_reviews.author: my-op

customer_reviews.title: great tool
customer_reviews.text: tool works excellent-exactly as described,we use it at a dealership-quality is good and is easy to use for all techs
customer_reviews.author: coachkw

customer_reviews.title: perfect for my needs:
customer_reviews.text: I have a car with very loud exhaust and I was worried about state inspection rules and the SCCA auto cross rules for loud exhaust. This Db meter is very easy to use and I especially like the max hold button so I can drive the car for a while then check the max Db reading. Very good meter, reasonable price. Good addition to my tool box. later
customer_reviews.author: Karl Mckeever

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: Really good. But a little expensive, My phone does the same exact thing with an app for free, I just bought this just to say that i had a "certified" item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: çok kullanışlı
customer_reviews.text: Amatör işler ve hobi için gayet yeterli bir cihaz. Fikir vermek için kullanılabilir. fiyat / fayda orano bence oldukça yüksek. Tavsiye ederim
customer_reviews.author: baki gundogdu

customer_reviews.title: Accomplished the job
customer_reviews.text: Not as user friendly as I had hoped and the on/off power button does not turn the power off instantaneously.
customer_reviews.author: A. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Did not realize it does not read below 40 dba , a waste of time for my purpose , otherwise works fine.
customer_reviews.author: eben w kunz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Although I can't test the accuracy it seems to work perfectly. Easy to operate. Large easy to read display. Fit's the bill perfectly! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Extech 407730 40  works as advertised, what's not to like?
customer_reviews.text: This is a nicely priced digital sound meter, it works as advertised. Easy to work, easy to adjust, end of story.
customer_reviews.author: SloopJohnB

customer_reviews.title: Extech decibel meter
customer_reviews.text: Accurate, straight forward operation. Simple to use and easily read meter for sound levels. Great for testing occupational sound levels and machinery near personnel.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Fitzkee

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: . Could not contain the gain while trying to get SPL reading from my speakers. Not going to return it due to part of the problem was probably was my own ignorance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome tool that does the job nearly perfectly. I am glad I bought it and it has worked out wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Jim W. Riess

customer_reviews.title: nice looking
customer_reviews.text: other than that it is not worth the cost of prime shipping. I turned the gain up completely. It registered 101 when my grand daughter yelled at 2 inches. At four feet 80 and at six feet under 70 Db. The t.v. in their house which is very high showed 55Db. So unless you are trying to see how loud something is at 2 inches do NOT waste your money. Bought it in early Sept and then went on an extended vacation (4 weeks). Tried it Oct 9 and those are the results. We tried monitoring my daughter's living room with kids screaming, the t.v. blaring and the dog barking, Not once did it register more than 70Db.
customer_reviews.author: Hal

customer_reviews.title: Would like to return meter, and get a meter that sounds off when noise level goes up. This meter works good.
customer_reviews.text: The personnel sound meter works good, l have only used it a couple of times. What l thought l was buying was a meter with a beep or some sort of sound whenever the sound goes up. I would like to return this meter and get one that sounds off when the noise level goes up
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thanks
customer_reviews.text: Dear all: I selected this rating because is Ok for me.I think that should have a space to do questions before buy or request something additional
customer_reviews.author: Sara Manzano

customer_reviews.title: Good SPL, but..
customer_reviews.text: It's good but not great. Becausae it does not have an output to transmit the signals to computer.
customer_reviews.author: runfast

customer_reviews.title: Have fun
customer_reviews.text: Have fun with this easy-to-use gadget: Measure the decibel level of your dog's bark so that when your neighbors complain--you can say authoritatively: I am sorry and will try to remedy the situation but I measure only 60 decibels at your front door. Measure the decibel level of your stereo and see how many hours a day you can listen to it without having to save up for a hearing aid. (I don't think you can measure headphone output with it). Measure the sound level when your uncle Frank passes wind so you can congratulate him on his new record.
customer_reviews.author: Laurence Sterne

product_meta.title: Extech 407730 Digital Sound Level Meter 40-130dB
product_meta.description:
Size:General Use Sound Meter| Style:Meter OnlyEconomical meter measures sound decibel levels for a variety of workplace situations including workplace machinery monitoring and audio/alarm system checks. Meter features a 40 to 130 dB adjustable measuring range with selectable A/C weighting and fast/slow response. Digital display includes 0.1 dB resolution plus analog bar graph for easy readability. MAX Hold function stores loudest dB level reached and auto power off conserves battery life over time. Features a digital display with a user-friendly analog bar graph.

AMAZON.COM
Whether you're monitoring workplace machinery, installing audio or alarm systems, or handling product noise certification and reduction, the Extech Digital Sound Level Meter gets the job done. This meter accurately monitors sound levels in a range from 40 to 130 decibels. It displays results in the large LCD display in two different ways, either by number or a fast-responding analog bar graph. The lightweight meter easily fits in your hand and can be used wherever you need it.



Accurately Measures Sound Levels
Wherever you need to monitor sound levels, the Extech sound meter will do the job. The meter utilizes a 1/2-inch electric condenser microphone to monitor sound levels from 40 to 130 decibels at an accuracy of +/-2 dB with a 0.1 dB resolution. A windscreen is included to prevent distortion in the readings. User-friendly settings allow you to choose between either A or C weighting. The unit also mounts on a tripod, providing convenient hands-free readings.

Large LCD Screen with Dual Reading Displays
The large, 2,000-count LCD display gives readings in large, clear numbers. At the same time, it shows the sound level readings using a fast-responding analog bar graph with a 50-decibel range that updates every 40 milliseconds for viewing varying trends. The unit has AC analog output and records max/min values over time.Compact, Lightweight Design
The Extech sound meter weighs less than 6 ounces, and is designed to fit comfortably in the palm of your hand. The meter is white with a black-framed screen and black buttons. Useful features include auto power-off, max hold functions, and fast/slow response time.

Product and Warranty Information
All of Extech's assessment tools are factory calibrated to specifications and work to spec. You can also add an NIST calibration certificate for audits if necessary for licensed testing. The meter measures 9 by 2-1/5 by 1-7/10 inches (H x W x D), and uses four AAA batteries.

The Extech Digital Sound Level Meter is backed by a manufacturer's one-year limited warranty on parts and labor.

What's in the Box
Meter, microphone windscreen, four AAA batteries, and user manual.






FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Sound level meter measures from 40 to 130dB with an accuracy of 2dB. The digital display offers a 0.1dB resolution and features a fast responding analog bar graph. User can choose A or C weighting. Max Hold captures highest reading. Includes microphone wind screen and four AAA batteries.

See more
feature_bullets: Auto power off and Max Hold function

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars191 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
